intro: Sphingium canaliculatum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and can be either opposite or alternate, depending on the growth conditions. Sphingium canaliculatum is also known for its role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
